channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Mattress on public footpath, 18th January
item.description:
Big mattress was dumped opposite 75/77 Upland Road about 10 days ago.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 62, Upland Road, East Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumping, 18th January
item.description:
I can see from the system that this issue was reported on the 7th of January and it still has not been cleared up. If a different department of the council is responsible for this area, please let me know.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Allen Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside 455/457 footscray road, 18th January
item.description:
My son’s friends tripped and had to call an ambulance as they were riding and the pavement came up and he feel off. Injuries to hand because of the pavement outside 455/457 near the bus stop. It is all cracked, loose and the whole area needs a full repair. My son a year ago fell off his scooter in the same place. Something has to be done asap.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Footscray Road, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road full of rubbish, 18th January
item.description:
Please send a road sweeper to the location. It seems like people just turn up in cars and leave all their rubbish on the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Swiftsden Way, Downham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Gas cannisters on pavement and gutter, 18th January
item.description:
I am disgusted we pay our council tax and the riverside and pavements are getting polluted with gas cannisters. I'm 76 and cannot keep clearing them away. You cannot recycycle them and if you collect them and put them in the edge of the grass they are a danger to pedestrians and balloons to wildlife. Our gutters are not cleaned regularly. Please remove these and make our area a safe and tidy place. When rhe riverside grass is cut the person mowing goes around them or goes over any plastic containers and foil, thereby polluting the riverside even more and eventually the river.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Finsbury Way, Bexley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Household rubbish on street, 18th January
item.description:
A bag of recycled rubbish dumped outside house, foxes have broken it open Similar all over Stamford Hill. House residents do all the time! It’s a health hazard and residents need to be fined,

item.title: Pothole, deep, 18th January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): M25, Epping Forest

item.title: Deep pot hole, 18th January
item.description:
Deep pothole has reappeared in the last month, had been filled it before but now is back. It is a major danger at night to cyclists who will not see it and could cause a serious accident or pedestrians crossing the road near to the school. Also damaging car suspensions - outside number 13 Chislehurst Road on side heading away from Bromley.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chislehurst Road, Bickley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 holes within the tarmac, 18th January
item.description:
They have been getting worse over a 2 week period, the buses seem to wobble when they go down them

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bedonwell Road, Upper Belvedere, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole 5 inch deep - cyclist would be injured, 18th January
item.description:
These potholes across a 20 metre length on Old Farm - one of which is right on the line a cyclist would take.. it’s approx 16 inches long, 4 inches wide and 5 inches deep. If a cyclist/moped goes into that they will be seriously injured from being thrown off their bike. This whole patch of this road is dangerous, most are deep enough to cause injury to people crossing in the dark also.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 365, Old Farm Avenue, Longlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
